name: They're Over There with Their Sister Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: _______ house is next door to ours.
questions.explanation:
Their.

	"Their" shows that something belongs to more than one person. Other possessive pronouns like this include "our," "his," and "your."

there.

	"There," like "here," tells where something is.

questions.text: ________ a friendly dog in our next door neighbor's yard.
questions.explanation:
There's.

	Don't pet a dog unless the owner is there and tells you that he or she is friendly.

questions.text: My _______ best friends are Shelby and Pablo.

questions.explanation:
too.

	"Too" means "also." A tutu is a ballet skirt.

questions.text: All four of us go _______ school together.
questions.explanation:
to.

	The word "to" has many different uses: "I like TO play." "I'm going TO the park." "This present is from me TO you."

its.

	"Its" is another word that shows ownership: "The train blows its whistle." "The dog wags its tail." "The horse stamps its foot."

buy.

	When you buy something, you pay money for it. "Bye" means "goodbye." "By" has many uses: "This book is by Beverly Cleary." "Will we be home by seven?" "By the way, this quiz is over now."
